sn25.1:4.2: “Mendicants, the eye is impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn25.1:4.7: and mind are impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn25.1:4.8: Someone who has faith and confidence in these principles
sn25.1:4.9: is called a follower by faith. They’ve arrived at certainty regarding the right path, they’ve arrived at the level of the good person, and they’ve transcended the level of the bad person.
sn25.1:4.10: They can’t do any deed which would make them be reborn in hell, the animal realm, or the ghost realm.
sn25.1:4.11: They can’t die without realizing the fruit of stream-entry.
sn25.1:5.1: Someone who accepts these principles after considering them with a degree of wisdom is called
sn25.1:5.2: a follower of principles. They’ve arrived at certainty regarding the right path, they’ve arrived at the level of the good person, and they’ve transcended the level of the bad person.
sn25.1:5.3: They can’t do any deed which would make them be reborn in hell, the animal realm, or the ghost realm.
sn25.1:5.4: They can’t die without realizing the fruit of stream-entry.
sn25.1:5.5: Someone who understands and sees these principles is called
sn25.1:5.6: a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
